intro: Nectandra, commonly known as the sandalwood tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, as well as parts of Southeast Asia. The tree is characterized by its aromatic wood, which is highly valued for its scent and use in perfumery and traditional medicine. Nectandra species typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, fragrant flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and others for their commercial applications.
